body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Governor of Kentucky

Your petitions the undersigned would respectfully represent that in the year 1860 the Grand jury of Jackson County indicted John W. Hubbard for carrying concealed weapons. And afterwards a judgment was rendered in said Court against Hubbard for the sum of Sixty dollars and costs for the offense. Hubbard is a young man with a widowed mother. and sisters dependant upon him for a support. Has been a Member of the 1st Ky Cavalry. And as such discharged his duties faithfully & in a satisfactory manner. He is very poor and really unable to pay the fine. With his constitution shattered by Exposure in the Service, we think it a hardship for him to have to pay it and and ask that you remit the Same think that this is a case really a proper case for Executive Clemency Oct 11th 1865
John W Hubbard is a resident of Madison County And his Post office Richmond

P P Ballard
Boston Dillion Ex Capt 1st Ky Cav
Thos Rowland
James H. Embry Clerk
Madison County Court
J W Bourne Judge
Madison County Court
R H Johnson, U. S. Assessor
F W Dillion late Capt 1st Ky cav
P S Fine Interest & Costs up to the Present date amounts to One Hundred and Thirteen dollars & 15/100

Jackson Cir Ct
vs
John W Hubbard
$60,
Remitted 13 Oct 1865
